byline.original: By JACK HEALY and SHARIFULLAH SAHAK

abstract: Afghanistan’s embattled spy agency absolves itself of any wrongdoing in case of wandering Islamic preacher detained by intelligence officials who ended up in a hospital, fading in and out of consciousness and seemingly near death; allegations of his mistreatment surfaced days after withering United Nations report detailing widespread abuse in detention centers.
snippet: Afghanistan’s intelligence service denied allegations of mistreating a detained Islamic preacher who ended up in a hospital this month.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

lead_paragraph: Afghanistan’s intelligence service denied allegations of mistreating a detained Islamic preacher who ended up in a hospital this month.

headline.main: Spy Agency in Kabul Denies Claim of Abuse
headline.print_headline: Spy Agency In Kabul Denies Claim Of Abuse
headline.seo: Afghan Spy Agency Says It Did Not Abuse Preacher
